qas.question: What type of climate does Cyprus have?

answers.text: one of the warmest climates in the Mediterranean

qas.question: In Cyprus, what is the average temperature during the day?
How long do summers generally last on Cyprus?
What month typically marks the end of summer on Cyprus?

context: Cyprus has <a0_0>one of the warmest climates in the Mediterranean<a0_0/> part of the European Union.[citation needed] The average annual temperature on the coast is around <a1_0>24 °C (75 °F)<a1_0/> during the day and 14 °C (57 °F) at night. Generally, summers last about <a2_0>eight months<a2_0/>, beginning in April with average temperatures of 21–23 °C (70–73 °F) during the day and 11–13 °C (52–55 °F) at night, and ending in <a3_0>November<a3_0/> with average temperatures of 22–23 °C (72–73 °F) during the day and 12–14 °C (54–57 °F) at night, although in the remaining four months temperatures sometimes exceed 20 °C (68 °F).
